metadata.title: CVE-2020-8694 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient access control in the Linux kernel driver for some Intel(R)Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-123-generic - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-4.15.0-123-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-4.15.0-123-lowlatency - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-123-generic - 4.15.0-123.126
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-123-lowlatency - 4.15.0-123.126
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-69-generic - 5.3.0-69.65
linux-image-5.3.0-69-lowlatency - 5.3.0-69.65
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-69-generic - 5.3.0-69.65
linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-69-lowlatency - 5.3.0-69.65
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1087-gcp - 4.15.0-1087.100
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-53-generic - 5.4.0-53.59~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-123.126').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-69.65').
